intro: Hemionitis cuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf water fern, is a small aquatic plant native to the wetlands of Southeast Asia. Hemionitis cuspidata plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small aquatic organisms and contributing to water filtration.
